NO, just no. ESPECIALLY IF YOU'RE IN THE US, READ THIS REVIEW!

I had been watching this brand evolve for years. Always loved their stuff from the jump, but had seen a few others give bad reviews (mostly on shipping and sizing not being consistent) that made me hesitant to pull the trigger. I should have listened!

I waited until BOA had a mega Black Friday sale and went all in. Spent hours narrowing down selections from different categories, researching and reading corresponding reviews to determine best sizing. When everything was all said and done, I spent almost 2 grand! I justified the money because I would use the clothes for work and got a discount due to the sale. Even though there are a few pieces I like, I regret ever purchasing and do not think the clothes in any way are worth the time, effort and money.

The First Reg Flag:
After I placed my order, I noticed BOA's instagram started getting blown up with negative comments from other consumers about missing packages and customer support not responding. Some users even started to comment more aggressively, noting that BOA was deleting their comments on top of missing packages and not responding. I got nervous and felt in my gut I should cancel my order right then and there... and I should have!

First Complaint- Shipping & Communication:
I placed my order and when I didn't hear ANYTHING from the company for over a week and the tracking information had not been updated, I decided to reach out. Megan responded a day later and sent new tracking information. Right then and there, the tracking info Megan sent said all three shipments were held and delayed due to a 'Customs Clearance'. I contacted BOA again and notified them the packages were stuck in customs and asked for their help. BOA responded that they were working on it. After a few days of no further advancement, I took matters into my own hands and contacted customs directly, myself. Customs said the packages were held because there was no package slip identifying the contents/items. Customs also said they had tried to reach out to BOA for further information to clear the package, but were unable to get in contact. I then asked how I could help. Customs said for me to send an itemized list of the contents of the package, including full details on the clothing's composition. I spent hours tracking down the contents of each package, copying and pasting information from the website for each item and sending the details to customs. After customs received, processed and had me sign some documents, they released the packages.

Second Complaint- Quality:
Despite my extensive research and personal measurements, the clothes did indeed all fit differently. I would say 60% of what I ordered fit appropriately and was accurate to the websites information for sizing. Many of the garments had loose seams with open holes and poor stitching. The same item in two different colors fit differently. Especially frustrating because I did my research, but nevertheless, I went to the website to process a return.

Third Complaint- Processes:
BOA charges for every return and does not allow items to be returned that are missing the protective crotch sticker. Um... how the heck is someone supposed to try on a bodysuit that buttons at the crotch when there is a sticker there preventing them from unbuttoning? The price for a return makes the return not worth it, in my opinion. I gifted what didn't fit me. Ugh, BOA got their money.

Now for the parts that make me REALLY MAD...

Fourth Complaint- The Wear:
I purchased some extremely overpriced 'alpaca' or 'alpaca blend' sweaters. One wear in and one of the styles was a disgusting pilling mess. A real obvious sign of cheap quality. One wear in and the other was shedding long strains of hair all over me and everything I own. Forget pairing cream or white with black! UGH!!! Any RESPECTABLE company should take the return after wear when the quality is this bad, and let you make the return FOR FREE.

Fifth Complaint- Customs Fees!
This one is the one that really hurt. After such a negative experience from start to finish, I just got a bill in the mail for OVER $500 IN CUSTOMS FEES! Are you kidding me?! Customs charged extra for the packaging slip being missing and having to key in all the content details. Yes, I'M being charged for that when it was poor handling/preparation from the COMPANY.

This has been a long review, so to summarize...
There are better brands out there, with the same quality, for a lesser price, with better policies and practices. Save yourself a lot of time, disappointment and money and stay away from this one. Kudos to all of the good reviews on here who bought one or two pieces, got them on time and liked them... I have a feeling they just got lucky and if they continue to buy, they will eventually be burned.

There is a rule in the Netherlands that states that if you return everything from the order the seller is obligated to refund the price for the products and the initial shipping (delivery) costs. Meanwhile the return costs need to be paid by the customer. I know that BOA is a UK based store so i went and looked at the law in the UK said and basically i found out that the EU rules also still apply for the UK. This means that the law states that the seller must pay for the shipping costs if the customer returns everything from the order. Because i returned everything from the order i am hereby entitled to receive a refund for the shipping costs. I have also linked the websites where i found this information and send it to them.
